HOME
Welcome to Timobo Safaris Ltd â€“ Experiences of Africa!

For over 18 years, Timobo Safaris Ltd has specialized in purpose-driven safaris in Kenya and tailor-made African safari tours across Eastern and Southern Africa. Our journeys take you deep into Africaâ€™s untamed wilderness, offering authentic wildlife encounters while championing wildlife conservation, cultural preservation, and community empowerment.

Whether you dream of an unforgettable Kenya safari, a thrilling Masai Mara migration experience, discovering the Serengeti, or exploring other Eastern and Southern Africaâ€™s hidden gems, our tailor-made itineraries promise meaningful travel that leaves a positive impact.

Beyond safaris, we are experts in MICE travel in Africa â€“ providing seamless Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, and Events solutions in major urban destinations across Kenya, Tanzania, South Africa, Botswana, and beyond. From corporate gatherings to incentive trips, we deliver professional event planning with a touch of African hospitality.

Why Choose Timobo Safaris Ltd?
âœ” 18 years of excellence in African safari planning

âœ” Bespoke itineraries for individuals, groups, and corporates

Timobo Safaris Ltd invites you to discover Africa â€“ where every journey tells a story, every safari supports sustainability, and every experience stays with your forever.
DESTINATIONS
Eastern Africa:
KENYA
Magical Kenya â€“ Epic safaris, golden savannahs and the Great Migrationâ€™s heart."

Kenya is home to the world-famous Maasai Mara, where the awe-inspiring Great Wildebeest Migration takes center stage each year. Explore Amboseli, renowned for its large-tusked elephants and stunning views of Mount Kilimanjaro at the backdrop; encounter the red elephants of Tsavo and the rare â€˜Special Fiveâ€™ of semi-arid Samburu; glide by boat past hippo pods on Lake Naivasha; or meet the critically endangered Northern White rhino at Ol Pejeta Conservancy. Hike the majestic slopes of Mount Kenya, trek along the dramatic Great Rift Valley escarpment, or soar by helicopter over the breathtaking landscapes of the northern Kenya. Then, unwind on the pristine white-sand beaches of Diani and Lamu or at private villa in Watamu. With rich cultures such as the Maasai, Samburu, and Swahili, vibrant cities like Nairobi, and unforgettable wildlife experiences, Kenya stands as one of Africaâ€™s premier safari destinations

Sample Itinerary:  
Considered as the Safari Capital of the World, Kenya offers some of the most iconic safari experiences on Earth â€“ from the vast plains of the Maasai Mara to the idyllic beaches of the Indian Ocean.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Nairobi National Park â€“ The worldâ€™s only capital city safari
Maasai Mara National Reserve â€“ Home to the Great Migration and the Big Five.
Amboseli National Park â€“ Breathtaking views of Mount Kilimanjaro.
Samburu National Reserve â€“ Rare species like Grevyâ€™s zebra and Somali ostrich.
Lake Nakuru & Lake Naivasha â€“ Where serene waters meet spectacular wildlife.
Laikipia & Northern Rift â€“ Adventure across untamed frontiers
Diani Beach â€“ Crystal-clear waters and Swahili heritage.
Best Time to Visit:
July to October â€“ Great Migration season.
January to March â€“ Excellent for game viewing and beach holidays.
10 â€“ Days Kenya Highlights Safari:
Day 1: Arrive in Nairobi & overnight.
Day 2: Full day in Nairobi with excursions such as visit Giraffe Centre, Sheldrick Wildlife Trust orphanage & Karen Blixen Museum.
Day 3: Drive to Amboseli National Park, afternoon game viewing drive.
Day 4: Full day in Amboseli with game viewing drives with Kilimanjaro backdrop.
Day 5: Transfer by air to Samburu Game Reserve, afternoon game viewing drive.
Day 6: Full day in Samburu with game drives in search of â€˜Special Fiveâ€™ animals.
Day 7: Transfer by air to Maasai Mara, afternoon game drive.
Day 8: Full day in Masai Mara with game drives (for The Great Migration, July to October).
Day 9: Full day in Masai Mara with game drives & cultural experiences.
Day 10: Transfer by air to Nairobi and depart or opt for beach extension to Diani, Lamu or Malindi.
TANZANIA
Wild beauty meets Island paradise â€“ from the highest peak to endless plains and spice-scented shores.

Tanzania is home to legendary wilderness icons â€“ the vast Serengeti National Park, the awe-inspiring Ngorongoro Crater, and Africaâ€™s highest peak, Mount Kilimanjaro. Witness the drama of the Great Migration, track elusive big cats, and explore the untamed beauty of Nyerere National Park (formerly Selous), Mahale Mountains National Park and Ruaha National Park. Immerse yourself in the traditions of the Maasai, Hadzabe, and Datoga tribes, whose cultures remain deeply rooted in their ancestral lands. Then, unwind in Zanzibar â€“ an island paradise of soft white sands, turquoise waters, spice plantations, rich Swahili culture and the UNESCO-listed and historic Stone Town.

Sample Itinerary:  
Tanzania boasts legendary landscapes like the Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater, paired with Zanzibarâ€™s tropical beaches for the ultimate safari and beach escape. Tanzania is truly where the wild beauty meets island bliss.
Top Attractions & Experiences â€“ Northern Tanzania:
Serengeti National Park â€“ Great Migration and iconic predators.
Ngorongoro Crater â€“ A UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Tarangire National Park â€“ Elephant paradise and baobab trees.
Mount Kilimanjaro â€“ Africaâ€™s highest peak.
Zanzibar Island â€“ Spice plantations and Stone Town.
Best Time to Visit:
January to March â€“ Best for wildebeests calving in southern Serengeti and Ngorongoro area.
June to October â€“ Best for safaris and migration.
December to February â€“ Ideal for Zanzibar beach holidays.
11 â€“ Days Best of Tanzania Safari:
Day 1: Arrive in Arusha, overnight stay.
Day 2: Drive to Tarangire National Park for a game viewing drive.
Day 3: Drive + explore Lake Manyara National Park and its tree-climbing lions.
Day 4: Full-day crater tour in Ngorongoro Crater with picnic lunch.
Day 5: Transfer by road to Serengeti, afternoon game viewing drive.
Day 6: Full-day game viewing drive in Serengeti for migration.
Day 7: Full day in Serengeti with game viewing drive.
Day 8: Fly to Zanzibar, time at leisure on the beach.
Day 9: Spice tour and Stone Town exploration.
Day 10: Full day at leisure.
Day 11: Depart.
Top Attractions & Experiences â€“ Southern Tanzania:
Selous Game Reserve (Nyerere National Park) â€“ Africaâ€™s largest wild sanctuary, endless wilderness and river adventures.
Ruaha National Park â€“ Tanzaniaâ€™s untamed heart where giants roam the wilderness.
Katavi National Park â€“ Africaâ€™s best-kept safari secret, raw, remote and remarkable.
Mahale Mountains National Park â€“ Chimpanzees by the shores of Tanganyika, the Africaâ€™s deepest lake.
Best Time to Visit:
January to February â€“ short dry months best for wildlife viewing and animal calving
June to October â€“ Dry months characterized by minimal rainfall hence best time for wildlife viewing as animals gather around water sources
14 â€“ Days Untamed Wilderness Safari:
Day 1: Arrive in Dar es Salaam, overnight stay.
Day 2: Fly to Selous Game Reserve (Nyerere National Park) for a game activities.
Day 3: Full day in Selous Game Reserve (Nyerere National Park) with game activities â€“ boat safaris on the Rufiji River, guided walking safaris, and game drives.
Day 4: Full day in Selous Game Reserve (Nyerere National Park) + activities.
Day 5: Fly to Ruaha National Park for game viewing drives.
Day 6: Full day in Ruaha with game viewing drives â€“ famous for large herds.
Day 7: Full day in Ruaha with game viewing drives.
Day 8: Fly to Katavi National Park for game viewing drives.
Day 9: Full day in Katavi with the ultimate off-the-beaten-path safaris
Day 10: Full day in Katavi with game viewing drives and activities.
Day 11: Fly to Mahale Mountains National Park and explore the area.
Day 12: Full day in Mahale Mountains to trek Chimpanzees.
Day 13: Full day in Mahale Mountains to explore Lake Tanganyika and its stunning beaches, kayaking and dhow boat rides.
Day 14: Fly to Dar es Salam and depart.
RWANDA
Rwanda is a rare gem where lush green hills meet extraordinary wildlife encounters, including the endangered mountain gorillas.

Rwanda offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to trek endangered mountain gorillas in Volcanoes National Park. Discover the tranquil beauty of Lake Kivu, hike through lush, rolling hills, and immerse yourself in the inspiring culture and history of Kigali â€“ one of Africaâ€™s cleanest and safest cities. Explore Nyungwe, one of the continentâ€™s oldest rainforests rich in biodiversity, or venture into Akagera National Park, Rwandaâ€™s only savanna reserve, where diverse landscapes create a truly unique ecosystem.
Sample Itinerary:
Rwanda is a rare gem where lush green hills meet extraordinary wildlife encounters, including the endangered mountain gorillas.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Volcanoes National Park â€“ Gorilla trekking adventure.
Lake Kivu â€“ Scenic lakeside relaxation.
Nyungwe Forest â€“ Chimpanzee trekking and canopy walk.
Akagera National Park â€“ The wild side of the land of a thousand hills.
Kigali City Tour â€“ Culture and history.
Best Time to Visit:
June to September â€“ Dry season for gorilla trekking.
December to February â€“ Another excellent trekking season.
4 â€“ Days Gorilla Trekking Adventure:
Day 1: Arrive in Kigali and overnight stay.
Day 2: Morning city tour and genocide memorial visit. Afternoon drive to Volcanoes National Park area.
Day 3: Gorilla trekking adventure. Evening cultural experience.
Day 4: Return to Kigali, shopping, and departure.
UGANDA
The Pearl of Africa â€“ gorilla encounters, wild rivers, and Africaâ€™s hidden safari gem.

Uganda is a land of rare encounters â€“ from gorilla trekking in Bwindi Impenetrable Forest and Mgahinga Gorilla National Park to chimpanzee tracking in Kibale National Park. Cruise the legendary Nile River, spot the elusive Shoebill stork in Mabamba Swamp, stand in awe of the thunderous Murchison Falls and enjoy classic savannah safaris in Queen Elizabeth National Park. With its diverse landscapes and warm hospitality, Uganda remains one of Africaâ€™s hidden gems for true adventure seekers.

Sample Itinerary:
Uganda offers a mix of primate encounters, stunning landscapes, and classic African safaris, making it a truly diverse destination.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Bwindi Impenetrable Forest â€“ Mountain gorilla trekking.
Kibale National Park â€“ Chimpanzee tracking.
Murchison Falls â€“ The mighty Nile in full force.
Queen Elizabeth National Park â€“ Tree-climbing lions.
Best Time to Visit:
June to September & December to February â€“ Dry seasons ideal for trekking.
8 â€“ Days Uganda Exploration:
Day 1: Arrive in Entebbe, overnight stay.
Day 2: Transfer air to Kibale National Park for chimpanzee trekking.
Day 3: Chimpanzee trekking in Kibale.
Day 4: Drive to Queen Elizabeth National Park for game viewing drive.
Day 5: Full day in Queen Elizabeth National Park with game viewing drives.
Day 6: Drive to Bwindi Impenetrable National Park.
Day 7: Gorilla trekking. Evening cultural experience and community interaction
Day 8: Transfer by air to Entebbe and depart.
ETHIOPIA
Cradle of Civilization and Natural Wonders â€“ ancient wonders, dramatic landscapes, and vibrant traditions."

Ethiopia blends rich history with breathtaking landscapes â€“ from the ancient rock-hewn churches of Lalibela and the royal castles of Gondar to the bustling cultural heartbeat of Addis Ababa. Venture into the surreal Danakil Depression (Africaâ€™s hottest place), trek the majestic Simien Mountains, and immerse yourself in vibrant traditions and the worldâ€™s original coffee culture in the land where it all began.

Sample Itinerary:
Ethiopia, the â€˜Cradle of Civilizationâ€™ blends ancient history with breathtaking landscapes, offering one of Africaâ€™s most unique and wild travel experiences. This destination is recommended for experienced adventurers seeking off-the-beaten-path, extreme trekking and cultural explorers.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Lalibela â€“ Rock-hewn churches, unique architecture.
Simien Mountains â€“ Dramatic highland scenery and mountains.
Danakil Depression â€“ Otherworldly landscapes and extreme temperatures.
Lake Tana & Blue Nile Falls â€“ Historical monasteries and waterfalls.
Best Time to Visit:
October to March â€“ Best weather for touring.
9 â€“ Days Ethiopian Discovery:
Day 1: Arrive in Addis Ababa, city highlights and overnight.
Day 2: Fly to Lalibela, visit rock-hewn churches.
Day 3: Full day in Lalibela to explore local cultures
Day 4: Fly to Gondar and drive to Simien Mountains, explore the local area.
Day 5: Full day in the Simiens Mountains trekking the primates and other wildlife.
Day 6: Drive to Gondar for castles and churches.
Day 7: Visit Lake Tana monasteries and Blue Nile Falls.
Day 8: Return by flight to Addis Ababa for cultural experience.
Day 9: Depart.

SOUTH AFRICA & CAPE TOWN
Come Find Your Joy â€“ A seamless blend of wildlife, culture, adventure and the â€˜Mother Cityâ€™.

From thrilling Big Five safaris in Kruger National Park and its exclusive private game reserves to vibrant Cape Town with its iconic Table Mountain, stunning Cape Peninsula, and world-class Cape Winelands, South Africa offers a seamless blend of wildlife, rich culture, and unforgettable adventure.

Sample Itinerary:
South Africa combines world-class safaris, vibrant cities, and breathtaking coastlines for the ultimate all-round experience.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Kruger National Park and private game reserves â€“ Big Five safari and activities.
Cape Town â€“ Table Mountain and V&A Waterfront.
Cape Winelands â€“ Wine tasting and scenic views.
Garden Route â€“ Stunning coastal drive.
Urban cities â€“ Johannesburg, Pretoria and Durban
Best time to visit:
May to September â€“ Best for safaris.
October to April â€“ Perfect for Cape Town and beaches.
9 â€“ Days South Africa Experience:
Day 1: Arrive in Johannesburg or Cape Town and overnight.
Day 2: Transfer by air to a private game reserve in Kruger area, afternoon safari.
Day 3: Safari and activities in a private game reserve.
Day 4: Safari and activities in a private game reserve.
Day 5: Fly to Cape Town, afternoon at leisure.
Day 6: Half day Table Mountain and city tour.
Day 7: Half day Cape Winelands tour.
Day 8: Full day Cape Peninsula tour.
Day 9: Depart.
ZIMBABWE
A World of Wonders â€“ From the thundering Victoria Falls to timeless wildlife adventures.

Home to the majestic Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe offers dramatic landscapes, abundant wildlife in Hwange National Park (for large herds of elephants and a top spot for viewing African wild dogs) and Mana Pools National Park (for huge concentration of elephants and exceptional canoeing and walking safaris) and authentic cultural experiences in a warm, welcoming setting.

Sample Itinerary:
Zimbabwe is home to the mighty Victoria Falls and some of Africaâ€™s most pristine national parks.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Victoria Falls â€“ One of the Seven Natural Wonders.
Hwange National Park â€“ Big game safaris.
Mana Pools National Park â€“ Large herds of elephants and home to African wild dogs
Zambezi River â€“ Sunset cruises and water activities.
Best Time to Visit:
March to May â€“ High water and powerful spectacle of Victoria Falls.
May to October â€“ Dry season for safaris and waterfalls at their best.
7 â€“ Days Zimbabwe Pulse:
Day 1: Arrive in Victoria Falls and overnight.
Day 2: Morning guided tour of Victoria Falls and evening sunset cruise on Zambezi river.
Day 3: Transfer by road to Hwange National Park for safari.
Day 4: Full day safari in Hwange and cultural village visit.
Day 5: Transfer by air to Mana Pools National Park for safari.
Day 6: Full day at Mana Pools with game and walking safaris
Day 7: Return by air to Victoria Falls and depart.
ZAMBIA
Letâ€™s Explore â€“ where untamed wilderness and thrilling adventures meets the mighty Victoria Falls, Africaâ€™s most iconic wonder.

Famous for walking safaris and stunning views of Victoria Falls (Mosi-oa-Tunya meaning The Smoke That Thunders as named by local), Zambia offers pristine wilderness in South Luangwa and thrilling river canoe-safaris and adventure along the Zambezi River. For extreme adventure lovers, Victoria Falls offers it all â€“ from bungee jumping, white-water rafting, and thrilling helicopter tours to exploring Livingstone Island and the heart-pounding Devilâ€™s Pool.

Sample Itinerary:
Zambia is home to the mighty Victoria falls and the birthplace of the walking safari and offers some of Africaâ€™s most untouched wilderness.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
South Luangwa National Park â€“ Walking safaris.
Lower Zambezi National Park â€“ Canoeing and wildlife.
Victoria Falls â€“ Shared with Zimbabwe.
Best Time to Visit:
March to May â€“ High water and powerful spectacle of Victoria Falls.
June to October â€“ Best for safaris and Victoria Falls views.
7 â€“ Days Zambia Odyssey:
Day 1: Arrive in Livingstone or Lusaka and overnight.
Day 2: Transfer by air to South Luangwa National Park for safari.
Day 3: Full day in Luangwa with walking safaris and game viewing drives.
Day 4: Transfer by air to Lower Zambezi National Park for canoeing safari.
Day 5: Full-day game viewing on the Zambezi River.
Day 6: Fly to Livingstone for Victoria Falls visit and sunset cruise on Zambezi river.
Day 7: Depart.
BOTSWANA
Botswana offers exclusive safari experiences in some of Africa's most pristine wilderness areas.

Discover the wild beauty of the Okavango Delta â€“ a vast, wildlife-rich UNESCO World Heritage Site â€“ and marvel at the great elephant herds of Chobe National Park, one of Africaâ€™s premier safari destinations. Your adventurous journey could also lead you to the Kalahariâ€™s remarkable desert ecosystem or the shimmering salt flats of Makgadikgadi Pans National Park for a truly unique adventure.
Sample Itinerary:
Botswana offers exclusive safari experiences in some of Africaâ€™s most pristine wilderness areas.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Okavango Delta â€“ Mokoro canoe rides through waterways.
Chobe National Park â€“ Elephant capital of the world.
Makgadikgadi Pans â€“ Stark desert beauty and meerkats.
Best Time to Visit:
May to October â€“ Dry season for peak wildlife sightings.
7 â€“ Days Botswana Pride:
Day 1: Arrive in Maun and overnight stay.
Day 2: Transfer by air to Okavango Delta, afternoon activities.
Day 3: Mokoro (dug-out canoe) rides and game drives in the Delta.
Day 4: Mokoro (dug-out canoe) rides and game drives in the Delta.
Day 5: Transfer by air to Chobe National Park for boat safaris on the river.
Day 6: Full-day game viewing drive & boat safari in Chobe.
Day 7: Departure via Kasane or Victoria Falls extension.
NAMIBIA
Endless Horizons â€“ where towering dunes, wild coasts, and desert wildlife meet unforgettable adventure.

Marvel at the towering red dunes of Sossusvlei, roam the untamed Skeleton Coast, and encounter rare desert-adapted wildlife in one of Africaâ€™s most breathtaking landscapes. From thrilling game drives in Etosha National Park to the awe-inspiring depths of Fish River Canyon and the seaside charm of Swakopmund, Namibia promises adventure at every turn.

Sample Itinerary:
Namibia captivates with its dramatic deserts, unique wildlife, and stark beauty unlike anywhere else in Africa.
Top Attractions & Experiences:
Sossusvlei â€“ Towering red sand dunes.
Etosha National Park â€“ Exceptional game viewing.
Skeleton Coast â€“ Rugged and hauntingly beautiful.
Best Time to Visit:
May to October â€“ Best for game viewing and mild weather.
7 â€“ Days Namibia, Desert to the Sea:
Day 1: Arrive in Windhoek and overnight stay.
Day 2: Transfer by air to Sossusvlei for dunes.
Day 3: Full day in Sossusvlei, sunrise over the dunes, explore Dead Vlei and Sesriem Canyon.
Day 4: Transfer to Swakopmund for coastal adventures.
Day 5: Transfer by air to Etosha National Park for safari.
Day 6: Full-day game viewing drives and activities in Etosha.
Day 7: Return by air to Windhoek and depart.

Our Story.

At Timobo Safaris Ltd, weâ€™ve spent over 18 years designing exceptional journeys across Africa. Our expertise lies in planning, coordinating, and executing tailor-made safaris and special-interest tours, as well as seamless MICE solutions for corporate clients across Eastern and Southern Africa.

We are more than a safari company â€“ we are travel designers and event specialist committed to creating journeys that connect people with nature, culture, and community ensuring Experiences of Africa to all our clients.

Our Services.
Luxury Safaris, Adventure Travel, MICE Solutions & Beyond

At Timobo Safaris Ltd, we specialize in creating unforgettable journeys and corporate travel solutions across Africa. With over 18 years of expertise, we craft tailor-made safaris, exotic holidays, adventure trips, and world-class MICE experiences for individuals, groups, and global brands.

Whether you dream of tracking the Big Five in Kenya, relaxing on Zanzibarâ€™s beaches, exploring Ethiopiaâ€™s cultural treasures, or hosting a seamless conference in Africa, we make it happen with precision, purpose, and passion.
Safari Experiences â€“ Authentic Journeys into Africaâ€™s Wilderness

Step into the wild with custom-designed safari itineraries that connect you to Africaâ€™s most iconic destinations. From luxury lodge stays to cultural encounters and conservation experiences, every safari is crafted for meaning and magic.
